title: Skewer, 19th century
markings: On blade or pin:  below the join  a Minerva head indicating a .800 silver fineness, a standard used from  1838-1973; maker's mark  of a diamond shape with a crowned "K" in the upper region, a cross in the lower region, a "J.S" through the center; a Bigorne on the opposing side.
creditline: Gift of Mrs. Abram S. Hewitt
description: Tapering blade or pin with terminal in relief cast with entwined double cornucopia topped by a peacock.

exhibitions.title: Feeding Desire: Design and the Tools of the Table, 1500-2005

tombstone.epitaph:
Skewer, 19th century.
19th century. silver. Gift of Mrs. Abram S. Hewitt. 1931-44-36.
